text: The 1880–1881 season was the tenth season of competitive football in England. ==International matches== England played their first home match outside London when they hosted Wales at Alexandra Meadows in Blackburn. {| class="wikitable" !Date !Venue !Opponents !Score* !England scorers !Scotland/Wales scorers |- |26 February 1881 |Alexandra Meadows, Blackburn | |0–1England v Wales, 26 February 1881. 11v11.com. Retrieved 28 June 2013. Archived 30 June 2013. | |John Vaughan |- |12 March 1881 |Kennington Oval, London | |1–6Report on England v Scotland match. London Hearts Supporters Club. Retrieved 20 June 2013 |Charles Bambridge (Swifts) (64 mins) |David Hill, Edgar Field (own goal), George Ker (2), Dr John Smith (2) |} * England score given first ==Honours== {| class="wikitable" |- !Competition !Winner |- |FA Cup||Old Carthusians (1) |} Notes = Number in parentheses is the times that club has won that honour. * indicates new record for competition ==References== ==External links== * *
title: 1880–81 in English football
